resources.string:
Which of the following statement(s) with regard to an abstract class in JAVA is/are TRUE ? 
 I. An abstract class is one that is not used to create objects. 
 II. An abstract class is designed only to act as a base class to be inherited by other classes.
 III. An abstract class can contain constructors.
An interface can contain following type of members. \n public, static, final fields (i.e., constants), default and static methods with bodies
An instance of interface can be created.
Many classes can implement the same interface.
